hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via Options Skew Normalization
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes with put/call skew >1.2 for 5+ days, a rapid normalization to 0.9-1.1 range coinciding with spot price breaking above 20-day high on >1.3x volume signals transition to BULL regime with 72% probability within 2 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Elevated put skew in neutral markets indicates fear premium. Rapid normalization suggests institutional hedging needs satisfied. Break above resistance confirms shift in sentiment. Current regulatory clarity (MiCA implementation) may reduce uncertainty premium priced in options.
entry_conditions: Skew normalizes to 0.9-1.1 range in single session

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to BULL (confirmed) OR BTC gains +5% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Skew re-expands >1.25 OR price falls below 20-day SMA

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Skew normalization + breakout occurs but regime remains NEUTRAL >60% of time, OR false breakout rate >35%.
